body_content.explanation: to take the stitches (= pieces of thread that have been sewn to hold something together) out of something:
examples: They unstitched the sleeves from the arm-holes of a jacket to make it look tattered and torn.

body_content.explanation: to change, spoil, or destroy something that has existed or been done previously:
examples: In two years she has unstitched almost every aspect of the business and re-fashioned it.
He was an astute politician whose career came unstitched when - after years of waiting in the wings - he reached the highest office.
